API¶

class jsl.document.DocumentMeta[source]¶

A metaclass for :class:`Document`s. Does some bookkeeping:

  • registers a document in registry
  • sets owner for a document’s :class:`DocumentField`s
  • creates _options and _fields attributes
class jsl.document.DocumentOptions(additional_properties=False, title=None)[source]¶

A container for document options. Its primary purpose is to create an instance of a document’s options for every instance of a document.

class jsl.document.Document[source]¶

A document

classmethod walk(through_document_fields=False, visited_documents=())[source]¶

Yields nested fields in DFS order.

classmethod get_schema()[source]¶

Returns a JSON schema (draft v4) of the document.

classmethod get_definitions_and_schema(definitions=None)[source]¶

Returns a tuple of two elements.

The second element is a JSON schema of the document, and the first is a dictionary containing definitions that are referenced from the schema.

Parameters:definitions (dict) –

Overrides some of the nested :class:`DocumentField`s schemas.

If DocumentField‘s document definition id (see get_definition_id()) is in this dictionary, the definition will be used instead of its document schema.
Return type:(dict, dict)
class jsl.fields.BaseField(required=False, default=None, enum=None, title=None, description=None)[source]¶

A base class for fields in a JSL document.Document. Instances of this class are added to a document to define its properties.

Parameters:
  • required – If the field is required, defaults to False.
  • default – (optional) The default value for this field. May be a callable.
  • enum – (optional) A list of valid choices. May be a callable.
  • title – (optional) A short explanation about the purpose of the data described by this field.
  • description – (optional) A detailed explanation about the purpose of the data described by this field.
get_definitions_and_schema(definitions=None)[source]¶

Returns a tuple of two elements.

The second element is a JSON schema of the data described by this field, and the first is a dictionary containing definitions that are referenced from the field schema.

Parameters:definitions (dict) –

Overrides some of the nested :class:`DocumentField`s schemas.

If DocumentField‘s document definition id (see get_definition_id()) is in this dictionary, the definition will be used instead of its document schema.
Return type:(dict, dict)
get_schema()[source]¶

Returns a JSON schema (draft v4) of the data described by this field.

walk(through_document_fields=False, visited_documents=())[source]¶

Yields nested fields in DFS order.

class jsl.fields.StringField(pattern=None, min_length=None, max_length=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

A string field.

Parameters:
  • regex – (optional) A regular expression (ECMA 262) that a string value must match.
  • min_length – (optional) A minimum length.
  • max_length – (optional) A maximum length.
class jsl.fields.BooleanField(required=False, default=None, enum=None, title=None, description=None)[source]¶

A boolean field.

class jsl.fields.EmailField(pattern=None, min_length=None, max_length=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

An email field.

class jsl.fields.IPv4Type(pattern=None, min_length=None, max_length=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

An IPv4 field.

class jsl.fields.DateTimeField(pattern=None, min_length=None, max_length=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

A ISO 8601 formatted date-time field.

class jsl.fields.UriField(pattern=None, min_length=None, max_length=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

A URI field.

class jsl.fields.NumberField(multiple_of=None, minimum=None, maximum=None, exclusive_minimum=False, exclusive_maximum=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

A number field.

Parameters:
  • multiple_of – A value must be a multiple of this factor.
  • minimum – A minimum allowed value.
  • exclusive_minimum – Whether a value is allowed to exactly equal the minimum.
  • maximum – A maximum allowed value.
  • exclusive_maximum – Whether a value is allowed to exactly equal the maximum.
class jsl.fields.IntField(multiple_of=None, minimum=None, maximum=None, exclusive_minimum=False, exclusive_maximum=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

An integer field.

class jsl.fields.ArrayField(items, min_items=None, max_items=None, unique_items=False, additional_items=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

An array field.

Parameters:
  • items –

    Either of the following:

    • BaseField – all items of the array must match the field schema;
    • a list or a tuple of BaseField s – all items of the array must be valid according to the field schema at the corresponding index (tuple typing).
  • min_items (int) – A minimum length of an array.
  • max_items (int) – A maximum length of an array.
  • unique_items (bool or BaseField) – Whether all the values in the array must be distinct.
  • additional_items – If the value of items is a list or a tuple, and the array length is larger than the number of fields in items, then the additional items are described by the schema in this property.
class jsl.fields.DictField(properties=None, pattern_properties=None, additional_properties=None, min_properties=None, max_properties=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

A dictionary field.

Parameters:
  • properties (dict from str to BaseField) – A dictionary containing fields.
  • pattern_properties (dict from str to BaseField) – A dictionary whose keys are regular expressions (ECMA 262). Properties match against these regular expressions, and for any that match, the property is described by the corresponding field schema.
  • additional_propertiess (bool or BaseField) – Describes properties that are not described by the properties or pattern_properties.
  • min_properties – A minimum number of properties.
  • max_properties – A maximum number of properties
class jsl.fields.DocumentField(document_cls, **kwargs)[source]¶

A reference to another (or the same) document.

Parameters:document_cls – string or Document
